alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Madison (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 24 at 2:39PM CDT until March 25 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and west central Arkansas, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Carroll and Madison. In west central Arkansas, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 4 PM CDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - One last band of thunderstorms will move across western Arkansas over the next couple hours. Some potential for localized flash flooding remains, but should be over by the time the watch expires at 4 PM as storms move off to the east. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
